You pay zakat on silver when:
• Amount: You own at least the nisab (612.36 grams).
• Time: You owned it for one lunar year (hawl).
• Type: Daily jewelry is usually exempt unless it is excessive.

• Type: Pure 24K gold kept for savings/investment. Daily jewelry is usually exempt unless excessive.

Kg of rice or staple food
Zakat al-Fitr is required for every Muslim at the end of Ramadan. It is a small amount of food or its cash value for the poor.
Pay with staple food (rice, wheat, dates) or cash. The amount is one sa’ (about 2.5 kg) of staple food.

Zakat on income (zakat profession) is up to 2.5% of net income.
I earn income from work or a profession.
I can meet essential living expenses.
My net annual income is at least the value of 85 grams of gold (3,825,000).
This has been true for one lunar year (hawl).
If you have meet the requirements, please calculate below:
Zakat on income is paid on earnings. You can pay monthly or at year end. The rate is up to 2.5% of net income.

You may owe zakat if:

- Income threshold: Your income reaches the nisab (value of 85 grams of gold).

- Time: One lunar year (hawl) has passed, or you saved a lump sum.

- Ownership: You own and control the money.

- Debt: After debts and essentials, what remains is above nisab.
Pay online by transferring funds to the official zakat account.
You are still not required to pay Zakat Income. But you can pay for Infaq or Shadaqah.

Rikaz zakat is 20% of buried treasure or minerals you find. It includes gold, silver, and other precious metals. It is due immediately.
If you find buried treasure or minerals, you must pay zakat on it.
Pay online by transferring funds to the official zakat account.
You are still not required to pay Zakat Savings. But you can pay for Infaq or Shadaqah.
Zakat is a required charity for Muslims. It means purification and is one of the Five Pillars.
Zakat cleans wealth and helps people in need. It reduces poverty and builds generosity.
Zakat is required for Muslims who:
- Own wealth that reaches the nisab.
- Have owned it for one lunar year (hawl).
Zakat is given to the poor, travelers in need, and other eligible groups.
There are two main types of zakat:
Zakat fitrah is a food charity paid in Ramadan before Eid. It is required for every Muslim.
Zakat al-mal is paid on wealth like money, gold, and assets. The rate is 2.5% after one lunar year.
The dua when paying zakat means: O Allah, make it a gain and not a loss.
You must intend zakat when giving. Without that intention, it does not count as zakat.
